items.title: Donald Trump’s tariffs, explained
items.author: Mia Sato
items.summary:
- US residents are part of what’s been called the "dumbest trade war in history" due to tariffs imposed by Trump on imports from China, Canada, and Mexico.
- A 10% tax on Chinese goods took effect in February, with an additional 10% added recently; a 25% tax on Canadian and Mexican goods began on March 4th.
- Tariffs, defined as taxes on imported goods, are mainly paid by the importers but are likely to be passed on to consumers.
- Economists assert that tariffs ultimately burden consumers and have noted that previous tariffs led to increased prices for goods like washing machines.
- Trump's approach to tariffs, including questioning their legality under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, has drawn criticism from experts.
- There is skepticism about whether tariffs truly lead to job creation in the US, with evidence suggesting that costs associated with tariffs often outweigh job gains.

items.title: Pokémon with guns? All the latest on viral gaming hit Palworld
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Nintendo and Pokémon have filed a lawsuit against Palworld developer Pocketpair, citing patent infringement.
- The lawsuit references three specific patents related to gameplay mechanics similar to Pokémon.
- Pocketpair has achieved significant success with Palworld, selling over 15 million copies in its first month of release.
- A major update for Palworld is expected in December, introducing the game's largest and most challenging island to date.
- Amid the lawsuit, Pocketpair is pursuing a mobile version of Palworld, partnering with PUBG developer Krafton for the adaptation.

items.title: CFPB staff and leaders clash about whether they’re allowed to work
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- CFPB leaders and staff are in a legal battle over the agency's future and employee duties amidst claims of attempts to shut it down.
- A lawsuit by the National Treasury Employees Union aims to stop the Trump administration's alleged efforts to reduce staffing, with key testimony expected from COO Adam Martinez.
- Judge Amy Berman Jackson expressed concerns about the agency's directives potentially leading to its closure before the court decision, prompting discussions on a preliminary injunction against terminations.

items.title: A new version of Monopoly replaces cash and math with a mobile app
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Hasbro announced a new version of Monopoly called Monopoly App Banking, replacing cash and the banker with a mobile app.
- The app manages all transactions, making the game faster and reducing cheating; expected availability is August 2025 at $24.99.
- Traditional properties have been replaced with kid-friendly options such as a rocket launch pad and moon, integrating features to appeal to younger players.

items.title: This Google change is breaking some digital photo frames
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Google is changing access to Google Photos libraries, impacting digital photo frames like Aura and Cozyla.
- Aura will disable its Google Photos auto-sync feature on March 17th, 2025, requiring manual photo addition instead.
- New API changes limit app access to photos, removing previous seamless integration.
- Cozyla is also stopping its Google Photos auto-sync feature according to user communications.
- Google's new slideshow features for Google Photos will not replace the removed auto-sync functionality.

items.title: Apple launched a new base iPad
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Apple announced the 11th-generation base iPad for the first time in more than two years.
- The new iPad features an upgraded A16 chip and double the storage at 128GB, starting at $349.
- Availability begins on March 12th with color options including blue, pink, yellow, and silver.
- The new iPad follows a series of Apple announcements aimed at upgrading their product lineup.
- The previous base model, the 10th-generation iPad, was priced higher at $449, creating confusion in the lineup.

items.title: Apple launches a new M3-powered iPad Air
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Apple announced the new iPad Air, featuring an upgraded M3 chip.
- The M3 chip is reportedly twice as fast as the previous M1 model.
- Available in 11- and 13-inch models, starting at $599 and $799 respectively.
- New Magic Keyboard attachment adds function keys and larger trackpad.
- Tim Cook teased the announcement with a graphic on social media.
- Apple aims to leverage recent momentum in the tablet market following success with last year's iPad models.
- The update raises questions about the iPad's purpose and whether the upgrades significantly improve user experience.

items.title: Alienware has a $549 QD-OLED gaming monitor
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Alienware announces a new QD-OLED gaming monitor, the AW2725D, priced at $549.
- The monitor features a 27-inch screen with a resolution of 2560 x 1440 QHD, offering excellent blacks and vibrant colors.
- It has a refresh rate of 280Hz, 99% DCI-P3 color coverage, and Delta E<2 color accuracy.
- The AW2725D is cheaper than the current $899 4K alternative, though it has a lower pixel density and potentially other compromises.
- Alienware introduces a curved 34-inch ultrawide model (AW3425DW) for $799, featuring a 240Hz refresh rate and HDMI 2.1 support.
- Dell continues to offer a three-year burn-in warranty on its QD-OLED monitors, ensuring customer protection.

items.title: Nvidia GeForce RTX 5070 review: definitely not a $549 RTX 4090
How to mirror your Samsung phone on Windows
The James Bond Cinematic Universe
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Amazon has gained full creative control over the future of the James Bond franchise.
- The episode features discussion on the concerns surrounding Amazon's acquisition of MGM and its impact on the Bond series.
- Framework launched a new laptop and desktop focused on repairability and upgradeability, discussed by its CEO on the Vergecast.

items.title: Trump imposes tariffs on Mexico, Canada, and China
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- President Trump imposes a 25% tariff on imports from Mexico and Canada, and a 10% additional tariff on China.
- Tariffs are expected to increase prices on various US products including food and clothing.
- Canada and Mexico plan to retaliate with their own tariffs, while China imposes a 15% tariff on US agricultural imports.

items.title: Samsung heard you like weird screens so it brought some to MWC
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Samsung Display showcased innovative folding concepts at MWC 2025, including a briefcase screen and a foldable gaming handheld.
- The portable gaming handheld mockup folds in half for storage and was a hit with attendees.
- A briefcase-style display was on display but was not meant to be touched by attendees.
- Another concept featured a Z Flip-style phone design with two visible inner screens.
- Samsung's booth included various bending, stretching, and flexible screen technologies, highlighting their innovation in display manufacturing.

items.title: The future of BMW is being built at a battery factory in Germany
items.author: Abigail Bassett
items.summary:
- BMW commits to offering EVs across all its brands, including Mini and Rolls-Royce.
- Invests billions in battery technology, introducing new "Energy Master" controller.
- Unveils the "Neue Klasse" all-electric architecture to underpin future EVs.
- New cylindrical batteries offer 30% more range, 30% faster charging, and 20% more energy density.
- Aims to decarbonize the vehicle lifecycle by 40% by 2030.
- Gen6 batteries are 50% cheaper to manufacture and can be individually replaced.
- Introducing local manufacturing approach to mitigate supply chain issues and tariffs.
- The "Energy Master" manages vehicle power efficiently, enabling advanced charging capabilities.
- Ongoing €650 million investment in a retrofitted plant in Munich for new product lines.

items.title: Waymo is now available exclusively on Uber in Austin
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Waymo’s robotaxi service launched in Austin, Texas, operating exclusively through the Uber app.
- The service covers a 37-square-mile area in Austin, not operational on highways.
- Initial fleet size in Austin is small, but plans to grow to hundreds of vehicles over time.
- Waymo and Uber had a previous rivalry, with a history of legal issues dating back to 2017.
- Users can opt-in for autonomous rides in the Uber app to increase the chances of being matched with a Waymo vehicle.
- Uber will handle fleet operations, while Waymo maintains responsibility for testing and safety.

items.title: Nothing’s Phone 3A and 3A Pro use AI to organize all your stuff
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- The Nothing Phone 3A and 3A Pro were announced with improved hardware and a new feature called Essential Space.
- Prices start at $379 for the 3A and $459 for the 3A Pro; the devices feature Snapdragon 7S Gen 3 chipsets, 12 GB of RAM, and 256 GB of storage.
- The main differences between the models are in camera specifications, with the Pro having a 3x telephoto lens compared to the 2x on the 3A.
- Both models include a 50-megapixel main camera and an 8-megapixel ultrawide camera; the Essential Space uses AI to organize screenshoots, voice memos, and images.
- The phones ship with Android 15 and come with a promise of three years of OS updates and six years of security patches.
- The 3A is available for order from March 4 and ships by March 11; the 3A Pro orders start March 11, shipping from March 25.

items.title: The Best Phones to Buy Right Now
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Most new phone purchases are for familiar, reliable devices.
- Features emphasized over hardware innovation in the current phone market.
- Recommendations include folding phones, high-cam phones, and flip phones.
- Detailed testing process for reviews includes week-long trials with personal usage.
- Top phone picks: iPhone 16 for its easy upgrade options, Pixel 9 for good camera quality, Galaxy S25 Ultra for its extensive camera features.
- Budget options are available under $500.

items.title: The Transparent Tech Renaissance: What You Need to Know
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Meta’s new limited-edition transparent Ray-Bans launching in March, limited to 3,600 pairs.
- Leaks reveal Sony’s WF-C710N earbuds will come in transparent glass blue with new features, expected release in May.
- Xbox introduces the Pulse Cipher Special Edition controller with a transparent red casing, available February 4 for $74.99.
- Hyperkin is releasing a translucent green Xbox Controller S for $49.99, inspired by the 2004 Halo-themed controller.

items.title: The best fitness trackers to buy right now
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Fitness trackers have evolved from simple step counters to sophisticated health monitors, capable of tracking heart health and recovery metrics.
- Essential features to consider include battery life (2-3 days), comfort, tracking metrics, accuracy, and phone compatibility.
- Key models mentioned: Amazfit Active 2, Garmin Venu Sq 2, and Garmin Fenix 7 Pro, covering various user needs from casual to serious athletes.
- Amazfit Active 2 offers solid health features at $100, while Garmin Venu Sq 2 excels in training tools for $250 without subscriptions.
- Garmin Fenix 7 Pro targets serious outdoor athletes with advanced GPS and health tracking at a higher price point of $549.

items.title: US tariffs: how Trump’s tax is hitting Big Tech and beyond
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- President Trump imposes 25% tariffs on imports from Canada and Mexico, and 10% on Chinese imports, effective March 4th unless certain drug imports are addressed.
- Automakers face significant impacts due to new tariffs, prompting prices to rise in the US.
- Acer CEO predicts a 10% increase in laptop prices in response to the tariffs.

items.title: TSMC announces $100 billion investment in US chipmaking
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- TSMC will invest at least $100 billion to expand chip manufacturing in the US.
- The investment includes building two new chip factories in Phoenix, Arizona.
- This add-on investment builds on TSMC's prior $65 billion commitment for three Arizona factories.
- The Biden administration awarded TSMC $6.6 billion under the CHIPS Act.
- TSMC began producing 4-nanometer chips in January 2025, with future factories aiming for 2nm technology by the end of the decade.
- The second Arizona plant's opening is pushed to 2027 or 2028, delayed from 2026.
- TSMC CEO announced plans for thousands of high-paying jobs and AI chip production.
- Apple's recent $500 billion investment plans in the US coincide with upcoming tariffs set by President Trump on semiconductors and imports.

items.title: Self-driving cars: Google and others map the road to automated vehicles
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- GM has ceased funding its Cruise robotaxi service due to high costs and regulatory challenges.
- CEO Mary Barra stated the shift to personally owned driverless vehicles aligns better with GM's core business.
- The Cruise division incurred a significant loss of $3.48 billion in 2023, prompting GM to realign resources towards developing autonomous vehicles for personal use.
- Waymo is upgrading its software to reduce excessive honking in parking lots following complaints from neighbors.
- Federal investigations are ongoing into several traffic incidents involving Waymo's robotaxis, focusing on compliance with safety regulations.

items.title: Google Play is going to start highlighting apps with widgets
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Google Play is introducing changes to highlight apps with widgets.
- New features include a search filter for widgets, widget badges on app detail pages, and a curated editorial page for widgets.
- The goal is to improve discoverability and justify the effort in widget development for developers.
- These updates will be available soon, according to product manager Yinka Taiwo-Peters.

items.title: Logitech’s best gaming mouse has fallen to its lowest price ever
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Logitech’s G Pro X Superlight 2 is on sale for its lowest price, starting at $113.99 at Walmart and $114.99 at Best Buy.
- Features include a Hero 2 sensor tracking at 500 inches per second, up to 32,000 DPI, and a 4kHz polling rate.
- The mouse weighs just 60 grams, has customizable buttons, 95 hours of battery life, and supports USB-C charging and Logitech Powerplay.

items.title: The FTC is being hit by terminations
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- At least a dozen probationary staffers at the FTC were terminated last week.
- The terminations affected staff across the Bureau of Consumer Protection and Bureau of Competition.
- The cuts appear to follow actions by Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), which targets probationary employees.
- This marks a significant staffing cut during the current Trump administration for the FTC.
- The FTC union acknowledged the terminations but did not know the full scope.
- The agency's internal equal opportunity office was reduced from six to three staffers.
- FTC staff were informed they would be moving into vacated USAID offices soon.

items.title: Overview of Apple Vision Pro Apps: Pros and Cons
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Apple’s Vision Pro launches with over 600 apps, despite lacking Netflix and YouTube.
- Microsoft Teams, Word, and Excel are confirmed for launch.
- The device operates within a highly controlled ecosystem, termed as 'walled gardens'.
- The web emerges as the standout app for the Vision Pro, meeting users' basic needs.
- Notable absences include the YouTube and Netflix apps.
- Vision Pro will feature 3D movies from Disney Plus at launch.
- iPhone and iPad apps are available in the Vision Pro App Store by default.

items.title: SwitchBot launches cut-your-own smart shades
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- SwitchBot has launched adjustable smart roller shades starting at $199, which allow users to adjust the width after purchase.
- They can be programmed to open and close automatically and are compatible with major smart home systems through Matter.
- Available in two colors and four sizes (small to extra large), the shades can be customized at home with a specialized cutting tool for the perfect fit.
- The shades feature battery power with claims of eight months of use per charge, and support USB-C charging and an optional solar panel for automation based on light.
- Competitive pricing compared to traditional motorized shades, which often start around $400.

items.title: The iPhone 15 Pro will get Visual Intelligence with iOS 18.4
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Apple's iOS 18.4 developer beta adds Visual Intelligence to the iPhone 15 Pro and Pro Max, similar to Google's Lens tool.
- The feature is expected to roll out widely in April after initial announcements indicated it would come in a future update.
- Users can access Visual Intelligence through the Action Button or Control Center on the iPhone 15 series, unlike the iPhone 16 which has a Camera Control button.

items.title: Microsoft’s new Dragon Copilot is an AI assistant for healthcare
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Microsoft announced the Dragon Copilot, an AI system aimed at streamlining healthcare documentation.
- The system features multilanguage ambient note creation and natural language dictation.
- It automates tasks like conversational orders, clinical evidence summaries, and after visit summaries.
- Microsoft aims to reduce administrative burdens on clinicians to improve patient care.
- Surveys indicated less burnout among clinicians using Dragon Copilot and better experiences reported by 93% of patients.
- Other companies, like Google, are also developing AI tools for healthcare.
- The FDA released guidance on generative AI devices, highlighting both benefits and risks associated with the technology.

items.title: YouTube is stepping up its efforts to sell you other streaming services
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- YouTube is redesigning its TV app to resemble Netflix, aiming for launch in the next few months.
- The new design will feature paid streaming content from services like Paramount Plus and Max on the homepage.
- This update seeks to improve accessibility to paid content, which was previously limited to the Movies and TV tab.

items.title: Microsoft Unveils Redesigned Copilot and Windows AI Features
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Microsoft announced a major redesign of Copilot at its NYC event, introducing a card-based interface with personalized features.
- New Copilot Vision allows users to see what they're looking at, along with an advanced voice conversation mode and virtual news presenter feature.
- Windows 11 gets updates like Phone Link status in the start menu, improved AI-powered search, and new features in Paint and Photos, including Generative Fill and Erase.
- The Windows 11 2024 update (version 24H2) starts rolling out today, enhancing user experience across the operating system.
- Microsoft's new AI CEO, Mustafa Suleyman, emphasizes a future of supportive technology with AI companions.

items.title: T-Mobile’s parent company is making an ‘AI Phone’ with Perplexity Assistant
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Deutsche Telekom announced the development of an AI Phone powered by the Perplexity chatbot at Mobile World Congress (MWC).
- The device, dubbed 'Magenta AI', will feature tools like Perplexity Assistant, Google Cloud AI, ElevenLabs, and Picsart.
- The AI Phone will debut later this year, designed as an app-less device primarily controlled by voice, capable of booking flights and making reservations.
- Images indicate it will be a budget to mid-range Android device with notable design features.
- The launch is planned for the second half of the year, with some AI features rolling out this summer through the MeinMagenta app.

items.title: Google brings Gemini widgets to iPhone as it looks to seize on Siri’s weaknesses
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Google’s Gemini app for iOS now features new lockscreen widgets for easier access to AI assistant functions.
- The update includes six widgets that allow users to quickly engage with specific functions of Gemini.
- Google aims to attract iPhone users from Siri, as recent reports indicate that Apple is struggling to advance Siri’s capabilities effectively.

items.title: Trump’s First 100 Days: Impact on the Tech Industry
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) has laid off hundreds of employees and is planning to reduce its workforce by approximately 50%.
- Trump is expected to announce a $100 billion investment by TSMC in U.S. chip manufacturing linked to his tariffs agenda.
- The U.S. government tech group 18F has been shut down by the General Services Administration.
- The FAA has reportedly been ordered to find funding for a deal with Starlink to improve air traffic control communications, potentially taking over a contract from Verizon.
- Trump outlined a ‘Crypto Strategic Reserve’ that includes Bitcoin, Ether, XRP, Solana, and Cardano, linking it to a recent executive order.
- Federal employees have been instructed to submit weekly lists of accomplishments, which raises concerns regarding oversight and transparency.

items.title: The US faces ‘devastating’ losses for weather forecasts, federal workers say
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- NOAA has laid off hundreds, planning to reduce staff by around 50%. 
- Canceled leases include important research facilities affecting weather forecasting. 
- Employees warn that cuts will lead to significant risks for public safety and financial losses.

items.title: Amazon's Panos Panay on the long road to Alexa's AI overhaul
items.author: Nilay Patel
items.summary:
- Panos Panay is responsible for devices and services at Amazon, including Alexa, Ring, Eero, and Project Kuiper.
- Recently announced Alexa Plus, an AI-powered upgrade for the voice assistant.
- Panay previously worked at Microsoft and replaced Dave Limp at Amazon, bringing a different approach to product management.
- Emphasized the need for collaboration and cultural shifts within Amazon to launch Alexa Plus.
- Discussed the complexity of integrating AI into existing Alexa devices while maintaining user experience for millions of customers.

items.title: Google’s Pixel 7 Pro is on sale for just $199.99 (update: sold out)
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- The Google Pixel 7 Pro is currently priced at $199.99 at [Best Buy](https://howl.link/0otdukqu305di).
- It's an unlocked device with 12GB of RAM and 256GB of storage, sold out as of March 3rd.
- Initially launched at $999, it's one of the lowest prices seen for this model.
- Features a 6.7-inch screen, 120Hz refresh rate, and triple camera array, including a 48-megapixel telephoto lens.
- Offers all-day battery life and IP68 water and dust resistance along with Google-exclusive features.
- Lacks some AI camera features of newer models and may not receive updates past October 2027.

items.title: BYD cars now have an on-vehicle DJI drone launch platform
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- BYD unveiled the "Lingyuan," a vehicle-mounted drone launching system developed in collaboration with DJI.
- The system costs 16,000 yuan (approximately $2,197) and is currently available only in China.
- The system allows drones to launch while the vehicle is in motion and can follow the car at speeds of up to 54 km/h.
- Included with purchase is a DJI drone (model not specified, but possibly DJI Air 3S), a roof-mounted hangar, and compatible apps.
- The Lingyuan system was introduced at a launch event in Shenzhen, with a version of the Bao 8 SUV pre-equipped with it.

items.title: Tim Cook teases a new Apple ‘Air’
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Tim Cook announced a new device in the Air lineup, with a teaser video on X stating, 'There’s something in the air.'
- Expected launch includes new MacBook Air models (13-inch and 15-inch) with upgraded M4 chip this month.
- Other rumored Air devices include new iPad Air models and keyboards, as well as a potential iPhone 'Air' model.

items.title: Doctor Who is ready to take the long way around again in new season 2 trailer
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- The new season 2 trailer for Doctor Who hints at an exciting return on Disney Plus in a few weeks.
- New companion, Belinda Chandra, portrayed by Varada Sethu, appears concerned about her adventures in space.
- The trailer suggests a mysterious connection between Belinda and the Doctor, with implications from last season's episode.

items.title: Google’s Chrome extension cull hits more uBlock Origin users
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Google is disabling uBlock Origin for more Chrome users due to migration to Manifest V3.
- The new standard aims to enhance privacy and security but removes certain features required by ad blockers.
- A notification will inform users that affected extensions are turned off and prompt them to manage or delete these extensions.
- The phaseout started in October but has intensified recently, impacting users and staff across platforms.
- Switching to uBlock Origin Lite is an option, albeit with reduced capabilities due to restrictions.
- Other Chromium-based browsers like Microsoft Edge are similarly affected, while Firefox continues to support both extension specifications.

items.title: MWC 2025: all the phones, gadgets, and commentary from Barcelona
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Nubia’s Focus 2 Ultra features a spinning camera zoom dial, enhancing user experience.
- Nubia Music 2 debuts with a loud sound system and AI music generator.
- Nothing unveils the design of their 3A series phones at MWC.
- Tecno's Spark Slim smartphone is a notable 5.75mm thick carrying a 5,200mAh battery.
- Xiaomi launches its premium EV, the SU7 Ultra, priced at around $73,000, and promises international availability.
- Realme's 14 Pro series comes with color-changing technology based on temperature.
- Infinix presents a solar-powered phone concept at the event, utilizing perovskite solar cells for charging.
- Lenovo showcases its ThinkBook Flip, a modular laptop with an extra-tall display.

items.title: Chip race: Microsoft, Meta, Google, and Nvidia battle it out for AI chip supremacy
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Intel is testing its 18A process again after a reported failure last year, with Nvidia and Broadcom engaging in tests.
- Nvidia plans to unveil its next AI chip, Blackwell Ultra, during its GTC keynote on March 18th. The chip is expected in the second half of next year.
- OpenAI is on track to finalize its in-house chip design, aiming to reduce reliance on Nvidia; TSMC will produce the 3-nanometer technology chip with advanced memory features.
- Intel confirms the cancellation of Falcon Shores, refocusing efforts on Jaguar Shores for system-level solutions.

items.title: All the news about Netflix’s gaming efforts
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Netflix's gaming future may incorporate elements of reality TV.
- Scheduled to release major titles like GTA trilogy in December.
- Netflix has expanded to streaming video games.
- Two years into gaming experiments, the company is enhancing gaming offerings.
- 'Oxenfree II' acclaimed as one of Netflix's best games.
- 'Laya’s Horizon' offers a unique flying experience on Netflix.
- Plans to make games accessible on all Netflix devices.
- Kid Cosmo, a puzzle game linked to 'The Electric State', is launching on March 18, 2024.

items.title: Blue Ghost private lander reaches the Moon intact
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- The Blue Ghost spacecraft, created by Firefly Aerospace, has successfully landed on the Moon, marking it as the first private lander to achieve this feat.
- The lander will conduct research operations for a full lunar day, including subsurface drilling, sample collection, X-ray imaging, and dust mitigation experiments.
- Blue Ghost was launched on January 15th aboard a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket and touched down on March 2nd, 100 meters from its target in Mare Crisium after traveling 2.8 million miles in 45 days.

items.title: Driverless racecar sets a new autonomous speed record
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- A Maserati MC20 Coupe achieved a new land speed record for autonomous vehicles by reaching 197.7 mph (318 km/h).
- The record was set at the Kennedy Space Center during an automotive event.
- The autonomous driving software was developed by Politecnico di Milano in collaboration with the Indy Autonomous Challenge.
- This record surpasses the previous record of 192.2 mph set by an IAC AV-21 race car in April 2022.
- The goal of the event includes stress-testing algorithms to improve safety for autonomous road vehicles.
- The Maserati MC20 features a twin-turbocharged 3.0-liter V-6 engine producing 621 horsepower and retails for at least $239,000.

items.title: Hulu prematurely ended its Oscars stream right before the final awards
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Hulu cut off its live feed before the Best Actress and Best Picture winners were announced during the Oscars.
- Viewers received a message stating "the live event has now ended," prompting complaints on social media.
- The premature end likely resulted from an incorrectly set broadcast end time of 10:32 PM, coinciding with the planned conclusion of the event.
- Earlier, Hulu acknowledged login issues for some users which were resolved shortly before 9 PM ET.
- Unlike Hulu viewers, cable viewers and those using TV antennas did not face this streaming issue as they received the uninterrupted broadcast.

items.title: Infinix’s new concepts use solar power to charge your phone
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Infinix reveals a phone with an integrated solar panel and a solar charging case at MWC.
- The technology, named SolarEnergy-Reserving, uses perovskite solar cells, allowing for efficient charging up to 2W.
- The solar case charges the phone while it's not in use and can be swapped for a regular case.
- Infinix also showcased a second-gen color-changing E Ink phone powered by AI for customization.
- The demo units were functional, highlighting potential future applications of solar technology in smartphones.

items.title: Instagram’s Threads: all the updates on the new Twitter competitor
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Instagram launched its Twitter competitor, Threads, on July 6, 2023.
- Threads allows users to share custom feeds, with options to pin favorite topics or accounts.
- The platform is testing ads, with initial ads appearing in user feeds in the US and Japan.
- Users can now schedule posts up to 75 days in advance, improving content planning.
- A new feature lets users reshare media without quoting the original post, crediting the creator instead.
- Threads is also asking users for feedback on its content moderation policies, signaling a potential shift in their approach.

items.title: Lenovo’s new concept laptop can be charged by the sun
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Lenovo announced the Yoga Solar PC, a concept laptop with a solar panel integrated into its lid at Mobile World Congress.
- The solar panel can convert sunlight into power at over 24% efficiency, providing enough energy for an hour of video playback after 20 minutes of direct sunlight.
- The device features Intel Lunar Lake, 32GB of RAM, and a 14-inch OLED display, weighing around 2.29 pounds and measuring 15 mm thick.
- Lenovo has not confirmed production plans yet, similar to the ThinkBook Plus Gen 6 which will become available in June 2025 for $3,499.
- An external solar power kit concept was also revealed, designed to charge devices via USB-C or a power bank.
